messages.message: Does anyone know why this value isn't extracting correctly with the '£' sign? I've tried advanced toggled on/off with the same response. Where is the 'PS' coming from?

@Gaurav Saini / @Gaurav Saini 
Can you check if digitisation is working correctly ?

@Vishnu Nair 
Are you able to share this email?
A few of our OCR engines do this. PS is for Pounds Sterling.
Ahh I didn't realise that either
On AI-Hub I can't see the option to see the OCR'd text, this is likely to cause confusion as I wouldn't be able to work this out as a end user and I'd flag it as an error
We currently don't display OCR text - more w.r.t UX as well as for latency. cc: @Varun Jain @avi
Makes sense, in that case I think it's a good idea to have some reference list / flag to user in the case of these OCR interpretations which wouldn't be obvious if at all possible.

I agree without the OCR output view its hard to know why this happens if someone doesn’t explain. Is there a way for us to know if the OCR engine has flipped a `£` to `PS`? If so can we just flip it back to a `£`
